Replies.Reply: wiry young man with a few blonde hairs on his upper lip struggling desperately to be a mustache.
Boat in the trees. It's a helluva thing.
You found it with me livin' in it.
Don't tell me you boys are from Mississippi?
Ward off evil spirits. A man I called an Indian but was Meskin said they were Seven-league boots worn by the seventh son of a seventh son. Told me it'd turn me into a werewolf but that's a lie.
They just good luck, but so far they ain't been workin' too well.
Neckbone? That's a real handle son. Where ya'll from?
Arkansas boys. Ya'll had me worried for a second.
Different places. Spent a lot of time back up near the White.
I know it. Guy named Tom Blankenship used to live back in there.
I like you two. You remind me of me. And seeing how you boys are from Arkansas and we know some people and sounds like we all from the same place I'd say we can make a deal here about somethin'.
stuck for now and what I got's runnin' low.
for now, but if you call me a bum again I'll have to teach you somethin' about respect that your daddy never did.
I'm in a tight spot. I just need a little help.
I didn't know if ya'll'd come back.
I try to never sleep in the same place twice. What you got there?
I was gonna try runnin' a trot line today. See how far that'd get me.
I'd been rationin' what I had...green bean never tasted so good.
Ya'll don't have to be afraid of me. I have two ways to protect myself out here. This shirt, and this pistol.
There are fierce powers at work in the world boys. Good, evil, poor luck, best luck. Men have to take advantage where they can.
I'm not waitin' for a guy. I'm waitin' on my girlfriend. Juniper.
Best lookin' girl I've ever seen.
That's because God made them for us to fear.
It's a thing we knew to be afraid of before we even got into this world.
Cherokee would wrap snake skin around their pregnant women's bellies. Induce labor, scare the child out. Here.

here. Me and Juniper. Sonofabitch swam right up under me, bit me just below the armpit. June got me out, got me to a clinic. Doctor said I shoulda been dead in twenty minutes. Took us an hour just to get back to town.
Gave me antivenom. For a cotton mouth. See here.
Problem with antivenom is they can only give it to you once. It's made from horse blood. Your body would reject it a second time. The cure ends up being more dangerous than the poison.
I die, or just sweat it out.
Mud. You can call me Mud.
I appreciate that, but I didn't expect you out here at night.
Look at that. You really know how to do somebody right. I didn't wanna say anything before, but it's hard to make a meal out of pumpkin pie filling.
I do. The first time I saw her was on this river. Just up from here.

That's right. I was younger than you are now, but when I came to in the hospital and she was there, it was like the world split open, came back together new. Everything changed. I knew from then on I'd do anything for her.
I've never been one to trust the government on matters of personal property, but if your parents love each other, there's always a chance.
People just sometimes forget why they fell in love in the first place.
That's good news. Real good news.
No. We picked another place to meet. Couple days from now.
Naw. I can manage. Hell I got out here didn't I?
I'm gonna have to go back on our deal for the boat. I don't feel good about it, but I don't see any other way outta what I'm into.
I didn't know about that, but it doesn't surprise me. There plenty of folks lookin' for me right now.
I shot a man. Killed him.
I'm sorry I didn't tell ya'll sooner, but I was hopin' to be gone before anything came of it. Didn't want you involved.
Ya'll have been real good to me.

With a boat like this I can make it to the gulf in two days. I could get anywhere from there. But I'd need a boat at least this big to make it on open water. It's got no title, no owner, nobody lookin' for it. It's my best shot.
It was a bad piece of business.
Juniper made a mistake. She hooked up with a guy. He was no good.
I was around, but me and Juniper were on the outs. She met this Hutchins, he sold her on some lies.
I understand if you can't help me anymore, but I need this boat. And I need to get it in the water fast.
I've made a list. Things we'll need. What do ya'll think?
I only got two things out here worth anything. This shirt...
protection, but if you help me get this boat in the water, the pistol's yours.
We get this thing floatin' first.
Ya'll scrounge what you can off this list, but if we're gonna get this done right we'll need more help. Can you fetch Tom for me?
I was hopin' to let that old assassin stay put, but we'll need him to get things ya'll can't. Can you find him?
Just tell him my name. He'll know you're serious.
Looks like we're on our own.
I didn't want you bein' the one to do this, but I can't see a way around it. I need to get this letter to Juniper. Could you take it to her for me?
You have to be careful. You can't just walk up and knock on her door, you hear me? You have to watch yourself.
This'll work for now. You get her my note?
His name's Carver. Brother of the man I shot. If he's here, then more are comin'.
Mud stops and turns to lay a serious look on them.
Ya'll listen to me now. If you see that old man, don't get near him.
Ellis, can you climb up that trunk and get these hung?
with a bowline knot. You know it?
Neck, start cuttin' line. Three fifteen foot sections. Count a foot long as your arm.
It's got a wolf's eye sewn in the sleeve. More protection than a bullet ever gave. Tom swears by it.
Tom's the closest thing I ever knew to a father.
It's hard not knowin' the ones you came from.
killed more people than you've met.

Bonfire's an all purpose cure all for bad luck. I don't know where this boat's been or what kind of person had it before me. For all I know it could have some serious bad business left on it. We got too much ridin' on this thing to leave to chance. Where's Neckbone?
You should. Tom loved a woman more than most men could in two lifetimes. They had a good life started together.
been alone ever since. Lone wolf.
King. That's what they call him.
He's their father. You didn't go near him did you?
Good. That left-handed sonofabitch is the devil himself. If he's here, then it's time. We need to get Juniper out here.
All right then. Give it a shot.
She probably thought Carver was on to her.
What was she doin' with the other guy?
Keep it. I don't need it anymore.
I did a lot of drinkin' last night.
Neck I'm gonna need you here to get the motor runnin'. Ellis I need you to do something else for me.
I need you to take this to Juniper.
I had a dream last night. I saw Juniper laying in a field with another man. They were making love. I walked out into the field.
I'll finish the boat, but I'd be surprised if I live long enough to sail on it. A vision of yourself is a sure sign of death. Neck can you grab me a socket wrench?
We just need to get him to a clinic! Is there still one in town?!
He's snake bit. A cotton mouth.
The sun does shine on a dog's ass some days.
I owe you your end of the deal.
The deal was for the gun, not the bullets.
I got one last favor to ask you.
We got the boat in the water.
Just now. Smooth sailin' from here on out.
Didn't feel right leavin' town without sayin' goodbye.
No. No. You were right to be mad.
I don't traffic in the truth too often. But I did love her. I do love her.
I just made mistakes. We both did.
That's not true. Don't judge your life on all of our mistakes.
No. I'm not. But maybe from here on out I can be...
Stay put! JUST STAY UNDER THERE!
Don't move Ellis. Just stay put.
I'm not worried about my dad killin' us.
It ain't gonna sink. We gotta move if we're gonna make it back. Set your watch. We'll need a good fifteen minutes.
It came down from up there.
We gotta go. I can't be late.
I saw that same boot print up in the tree. It has a cross in the heel. Somebody's been in our boat.
You got crosses in your heels.
He still does. His boat's cross from mine.
Why don't you go get your own food?
When they show up, you'll leave?
And when you leave, that boat's ours?
Neck and I got caught up helpin' Galen.
Said he had something for me.
What'd Momma wanna talk to you about?
This mornin', what'd she wanna talk with you about?
I wasn't spyin', just heard ya'll.
I came by for that book.
You said Galen had a book might help me out.
Maybe. I don't know. I think he just needed some help.
I think I'm gonna go back, take him some food.
I think it's the right thing to do.
What do you know about Tom Blankenship?
Mr. Blankenship, what do you know about him?
I don't know. He looks lonely over there.
I guess we should try the boat.
Who's this guy you're waitin' on?
What happens if you get bit again?
We gotta go help Neck's uncle.
We went to Junior High with you, before you went to High School.
No. Did you see her hands?
Sorry. We know a guy we think might know that girl.
I'm gonna go see if it's her.
It's her. I saw the tattoos. He wasn't lyin'.
But you and me can still live out here. Game and fish can't take your boat. Not while you're still in it.
But that ain't right. You work outta here. We got the ice machine, the traps. What are we supposed to do?
I ain't no townie. I ain't livin' like that.
But ya'll are married. Ya'll are s'posed to love each other.
I got you some Beanie Weenie.
Can I get one of those?
You been out here too long.
The girl you're waitin' on, she's your girlfriend?
My dad says my parents may be gettin' a divorce.
If it happens, and my mom moves us off the river, they say the government can come take our boat away.
I didn't talk to her, but she had the birds tattooed on her hand like you said. You were right. She's pretty.
At the Piggly Wiggly. I think she's stayin' at a motel by there.
Does she know you're out here?
You wanna go tonight? I can give you a ride up river.
You need me to come get you?
What do you wanna talk about? You want to leave and that means they can tear up our house.
My mom and I were headed to Wal-
No. That's why I called you. We gotta warn him.
He's goin' to get Juniper today. I went out there last night and told him where we saw her. He needs to know people are lookin' for him.
He loves her Neck. He told me.
So you know about the state troopers?
I need to hear about it.
You did it for her? To protect her?
I know where he lives, but I've never spoke to him.
I came to find you. I got a message for you.
He asked me to come get you.
No sir. Mud needs your help.
You still got that trailer you made for your bike?
I say we start at the top, work our way down.
We're sellin' fish. You wanna buy some?
Mud sent us to give this to you.
I think it's a couple days. He wants to get a boat for ya'll.
We'll be all right. Keep your door locked. We'll be in touch.
Hello? Is May Pearl there?...This is Ellis...Hey, it's Ellis. Hey...
We came up on Juniper's room. A guy was in there beatin' up on her.
I don't know. Tall. Looked like a cowboy.
What'd you mean when you called Tom an assassin?
I guess. You got a lot of friends.
You're wrong about Juniper. They love each other and they're gonna make it. If you weren't a wore out old man you'd know it was true.
Helpin' his uncle with a dive.
Tom called me over to his place this mornin'.
I told him he was a wore out old man. Told him he couldn't know how much you loved Juniper.
I gotta go help my dad.
A kid in town. He got his too.
I'm talkin'. I'm talkin' to both of you. That's all ya'll want to do is talk.
We could take it apart. Bring it out piece by piece.
It's true. He built his own dirt bike.
I don't know. That motor's worth somethin'. It's not like this other junk.
Yeah. It's time to take you out to him.
He's got a plan for ya'll to get away. Be ready tomorrow at five.
I'll take care of that. Just be ready at five.
It's okay. He's got the boat. We helped him fix it up. It's a good plan. Just be ready.
Take your bike around the side.
We're gonna have to tell Mud.
Just leave it. Mud'll have to help get it.
I'll just tell him the truth.
She didn't meet up with us.
She was supposed to meet us on the side of the motel. She never showed up. We went asking for her.
We tracked her down. She was there with another guy.
She knew the plan Mud. She just didn't show up.
What do you want us to do?
You think it's all right to leave him alone?!
Hello? Is May Pearl there...This is Ellis...I called yesterday, you give her my message?...My name is Ellis. I'm her boyfriend...Oh, she's asleep...I said she's asleep?
I don't know what you're sayin'.
We thought it was junk. We didn't think it was worth anything.
I can't take that motor back. But I'll pay him for it. I'll pay him what he wants for it.
He had something else on his mind.
We saw what's left of your bonfire.
You do some drinkin' last night?
Hello. I saw the guy you're lookin' for...Yeah, he's crazy lookin'. Saw him at the Wal-mart outside of Gillet. He was buyin' some beanie weenie...'bout five minutes ago.
I'm supposed to give this to you.
All you had to do was be there.
Then why'd you even come here?
I know he'd do anything for you.
I called you twice yesterday. Your sister didn't tell you?
I'm sorry, I just wanted to know why you hadn't called me back.
Don't. Wait. We can make this work. We can figure it out. I love you.
Stop it! That's mom's stuff! STOP  IT!
You said you loved her and you lied. You gave up on her and she gave up on you just like everybody else. I trusted you. Bonfires and crosses. Wolf's eye bullshit.
EVERYTHING YOU'VE TOLD ME WAS A LIE! You never cared about her.
How'd I get to the doctor?
She loves you too. She said it.
My dad says you can't count on women lovin' you. He says you can't trust it.
You're a good man too Mud.
Said he couldn't watch it. He's pickin' me up in a minute. Got deliveries today.
I don't know. I hope not.
I gotta go. Come by the apartment.
I just want to have a conversation.
If you don't look up from that goddamn paper...
Do you need me to fix you somethin'? Have you eaten?
Let's sit down for dinner tonight okay? Will you make it home by seven?
I'm going to Wal-Mart. I need you to come with me.
Ellis I know what your father told you last night. That's not what I wanted. I wanted to sit you down and talk about it.
I've spent my whole life on that boat. I don't think it's too much to ask for your...
Oh no. I hope no one's hurt.
I'm just saying there are two sides to this. I haven't made up my mind about anything because I want you to be involved in my decision, but I need a change Ellis. I deserve one.
How would you feel about moving into town with me?

Please don't tell your father this, but I've been looking at a couple of places. I know it would be a big adjustment for you, but it might end up being something you like. You know living on the river isn't exactly everyone's idea of the good life. Ellis?
Are you even listening to me?
What time are you gonna be home?
You can't make other people change Ellis. If I'm unhappy then I'll have to be the one to change something.
Take your hands off him Senior!
Don't you blame this on me. One doesn't have a thing to do with the other and you know it.
You're a man who's never had the strength to support his own life.
Ellis. You'll return that motor from where you found it and you'll apologize in person to the man you took it from. I won't hear about anything like this again.
It's okay. You're okay. Just set back.
You're home. We got you home.
The doctors gave you some medicine.
A man brought you in. No one knew him.
It's okay. You just need to rest up now. We can talk all about it later. Do you need anything? Are you hungry?
I'll be back in to check on you but just try and sleep if you can.
She's got nice titties. You talk to her?
You're gonna have to talk to her.
Remind me when we get back to my house, Galen's got a book on that.
Your dad'd kill us he knew we went out there.
Galen thinks it's been here awhile.
It's got its own shitbox Neckbone slides back a portion of floral curtain and light streams in. He starts opening small closets and drawers.
Look at that beave. You gotta see this.
We gotta go if you wanna make it back.
Your dad's gonna kick our ass.
I'm Neckbone, he's Ellis, and mister you may be stone ass crazy but I know you're not the owner of that boat, not for nine tenths of nothin'.
What do you care where we're from?
This guy's a bum Ellis. Come on.
He's a bum Ellis, let's go.
Aw, yeah. We gotta give it a minute. You hear that music?
That means he's doin' it. That's his doin' it song.
Well he can swim his ass off that island and get some.
Pearls. Galen finds 'em in some of the mussel shells. Most of 'em ain't worth dick, but he likes to make necklaces for the girls. Come on, let's get that book.
I don't want you goin' back out there by yourself. That river's scary enough with two people, and I don't trust that guy.
Galen said this really turned things around for him.
You really going back out there?
Well...I'll be over in the mornin' then.
What you got that pistol for?
Here you go, Mud. I think you need that worse than I do.
You start datin' I bet her dad'll give you a free pick-up truck.
You ever seen that girl before?
Into the Piggly Wiggly. She came from the motel.
I gotta go check on Galen. We'll pick you up out front.
I knew it! I told you that crazy sonofabitch was trouble. Did they say what he did?
You think he doesn't know that already? Jesus Ellis, why do you think he's on that island? You don't even know what he's wanted for.
Ellis! I'm serious. We don't know who this guy is.
I don't give a shit who he loves.
It sounds like a shitload of state troopers think different.
No tellin' where the hell he's been sleepin'.
The ones spreadin' your picture all over the place. Stoppin' cars on 165 searchin' for your ass.
I think you want us to run around, stickin' our necks out, gettin' everything you need, just so you can take our boat.
What do we get out of it?
I guess we could work a deal like that.
Be careful. Galen always said that old man's crazy.
He's really givin' it to him.
He loves her. You can tell that much. You gonna take it to her?
I don't know. Could be a lot of trouble.
We've got more, but no motor.
Ellis rushed him. Got smacked for it.
you'd lose your pistol for it?
He said he wasn't your daddy.
Well if you're gonna do it do it!
I can tell you this helmet smells like my duck butter.
It's welded. We'd just tear it up.
There's a motor in the scrap yard might work.
I can get it runnin'. Tell him Ellis.
Gimme a quarter. This shit took mine.
It's all right man. She's with her family. Come on. I wanna get that motor before dark.
I'll sleep over at your house tonight! We can check on him first thing tomorrow!
I guess he didn't care about bein' seen.
Ellis! Ellis, stop for a second!
MUD! ELLIS FELL! HE FELL IN THE  CREEK!
HE FELL INTO SNAKES! THE SNAKES!
IS HE OKAY?! Is he bit?!
My bike should be just over that ridge!
I wish Ellis could see it.
Mud dinged the shit out of it.
It's bullshit. They ever find Tom?
Heard on the news. They still hadn't found Mud's body.
You're s'posed to be helpin' me. I had to load this myself.
Just get in the back. Can't be later than we are.
It's ten you do your share. I loaded this mornin'. That makes it five.
Hadn't you seen enougha him today?
You see anymore Ding Dongs over there?
You spy on me in my own house?
Some people move to this river to work on it, and some move here to be left alone.
I work you hard 'cause life is work. You know that?
Your Mamma's been talkin' 'bout movin' in town.
She seems set on it. Wants to separate. She may ask me for a divorce.
It means enjoy the river son.
The houseboat's in your mother's name. Her daddy give it to her not me. If she wants to leave it, Game and Fish has ever' right to take this boat apart board by board.
Like I said, this is your mother's business.
I've let you down. A man should be in charge of his own affairs, but I haven't worked it like that.
I don't know about that anymore.
Where'd you get that black eye?

Well, that's your mother. Would rather tongue lash a problem than step up and handle it. You'll see one day. Women are tough. They'll set you up for things. You can't trust love, Ellis. If you're not careful, it'll run out on you. You just gotta pick a woman and roll the dice. Hope you don't wake up in fifteen years hatin' each other.
What the hell have you been doing?
You tell her. You tell her what you've been up to.
J.J. Crawford said a boat motor went missin' from his stock yard.
Now you tell me right now, did you steal that motor?
You tell me I raised a thief?
You take property that's not yours.
Shut your mouth. You think you can take things and not have him see it? Neither one of you has any respect for a man's livelihood. A life that puts clothes on your back and food in your stomach.
Don't tell me what I know. If you can steal a man's life out from under him in front of your son and think he won't take a lesson from it than you're even dumber than you look.
remember this when you watch them rip this house apart board by board. You Hear Me!
I don't care what you do Ellis.
What the hell are you doin'?!
Ellis dammit! What the hell's wrong with you?!
Take it. Put this damn thing out.
Come on. Let's let him rest.
Ellis? You mind your mother okay?
You look like a good enough kid. A word of advice, don't grow up to be like your shit heel uncle.
You hear me? You treat a woman like a princess. Got it?!
A lot of people are comfortable with that kind of thing in the bedroom. Some people aren't. We know that about you now...
That's a good book. Be sure you do the worksheets in the back. Let's get some dinner Neck.
So you really think these'll work under water?
You don't need to tell me anything?
I know I'm just your uncle, not much of a parent. But you can tell me things if you need to.
Ellis takes a seat on the other end of the couch. Galen pats the spot next to him. Ellis scoots over, uncomfortable.

I found it in the river. Works great. Best ceiling fan I've ever owned. This river brings a lotta trash down it. Some a that trash is worth a lotta money, some of it's not. You gotta know what's worth keepin' and what's worth lettin' go. You know the difference?
Neck looks up to you. Don't get my nephew into anything you can't get him out of.
Help Me Rhonda's just about a guy needing to get a piece to get over a girl that put one over on him.
Ya'll wanna hang out? Alan's comin' over. We're gonna pump it up.
Should be. I rigged DC power up through marine batteries. Makes it portable. Gave you a rigging bar to set on your shoulder.
You didn't have to do that.
Fourteen? You know you just punched a Senior?
If you can find my phone number, you should call it.
You must really like to fight?
But you're not scared if you have to.
She said she didn't like him that much. I told her I thought he was all right.
What the hell are you doin' here Ellis?!
You can't just run up and punch people I'm with!
Why would I call you back Ellis?
I'm not your girlfriend! We went on one date. One!
But what Ellis?! What did you expect?!
Holy shit Pryor, get off your ass.
Can you open the trunk please ma'am?
Have you picked up or seen any hitchhikers today ma'am?
Son, have you seen this man?
We've had reports that he's in this area. If you see him, call 9-1-1 immediately.
You deaf boy? I said why're you huntin' me?
What you got to say he can't tell me himself?
What do you know about it?
Why you out here like this?
You've spent your whole life followin' that girl! She's run you halfway cross the country and back, and for what? For this, left out on an island beggin' for help. A murderer. A thief.
What would you call it then? Don't even mention draggin' those boys into this. Do you have any idea what you're doin'?
Don't expect help from me. There's none to be given.
Mud didn't have no daddy. No mother I ever knew of. He was livin' in the woods when I met him.
You don't have to lie to me boy.
How long have you known Mud?
Well that's long enough to know he's full of shit.
I was a sharpshooter in the army.
You think he's a bad ass don't you?
You know why he's stuck out on that island?
He tell you why he shot that man?
they knew to never touch her again.
Come on son. You need to see this.
I don't want no damn fish.
How much is your fish? I'll buy the cooler full.
He tells me to hold tight.
But I don't want ya'll involved.
Thank god. I've been goin' crazy in this room. Is Mud okay?
Wait. Just wait. I don't know about alla this. I don't even know what he thinks we're gonna do.
Why are you even doing this?
I was wonderin' when I'd see you.
I'm sorry about last night. I didn't plan on...
I came here to leave with him. I really did. But now...now I guess I just came to say goodbye.
You don't know us Ellis. We've been headin' this way for a long time.
Mud's a born liar. That's what makes him so likable. He makes people feel good about themselves.
I do love him Ellis. But I can't spend the rest of my life runnin' with him. I may not know what kind of life I want, but I know that's not it.
It says it's over. Tell him I've packed my things. Tell him I've gone.
KEEP LYIN'! KEEP LYIN' AND I'LL  CRACK YOUR NOSE OPEN!
You hear me bitch? Tell me another lie.
Who are you!? Who the hell are you!? Did he send you!?
You know this man!? Look at him!
I know you know where he is. And I swear to God I'll cut through every one a you to find him.
We know you came here for him, and we know he's too stupid to leave you behind. So when he pops his head out of whatever shithole he's staying in, I'll be there. You tell him that.
And you need to mind your business boy.
Daddy this is Miller. He's one of ours.
We'll be in in a minute.

They work in shifts. Two outside her motel, the others either out searching or sleepin' here. I met with the county sheriff but he wasn't much help. Said they'd handle their own business, but I got two of their people on payroll and a person on the inside at the state police.
All but two now. Nelson and James are watchin' her place. I called the rest in.
This is my father, King. He runs the show.
I'm sure sorry about that. Ya'll caught me at a real bad time.
Hold on now. One second. I don't want ya'll thinkin' I'm a bad guy.
Let's just say I bought that whole batch of fish ya'll were sellin'.
I bet ya'll really get around this town. Probably know every hole and ditch. Have ya'll come across the man whose picture I showed you?
You sure about that? Take a look with your good eye.
What about that girl in the motel?
There's a number on there. Ya'll let me know if you do.
Ellis looks out the car window at HIGH SCHOOL KIDS that have gathered in the Piggly Wiggly parking lot. His hair is slicked to one side, and he's wearing a collared shirt.
Senior climbs out of the truck and enters the restaurant.
How do you do? Appreciate your help.
Good. Doin' good. Who all's here?

Men. I wanna thank you for the work you're doin'. It's important work, and I want you to know what it means to me personally. I'm grateful for it. No man should have to bury his son. It's not natural, and it's a pain I hope none of you ever have to endure.
This man did that to me. He took my youngest boy. And now, you're gonna help me get him.
a circle. I want ya'll to join hands.
Bow your heads. I need you to help me pray for the death of the man that killed my son.
Now where'd you say you were?...Okay...He's gone.
